entry.title: Unbreakable Chains
entry.summary:
Author: Ireadtoomanybooks

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 359Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 0

Summary: Merlin never wanted to come to Camelot. But with his home reduced to ashes and nowhere else to turn, he has no choice but to seek refuge with his uncle, a court physician under King Uther’s rule. All he wants is a quiet life—one of healing, learning, and keeping his strange gifts hidden.But the moment he steps within Camelot’s walls, he feels it. A presence watching. A hunger waiting.Prince Arthur Pendragon is nothing like the noble protector of legends. He is ruthless, possessive, and drawn to Merlin in ways neither of them fully understand. Every time Merlin tries to escape, Arthur is there to catch him—tender, terrifying, and utterly unwilling to let him go.

entry.title: The Fragility of Innocence
entry.summary:
Author: httphowell

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 58,621Chapters: 15/27Kudos: 95

Summary: Merlin, the crown prince of Camelot, is renowned for his beauty and grace but lives a sheltered life under the watchful eye of his father, King Balinor, who views him as fragile. entry.title: Folk Magic and Belief - A Crash Course
entry.summary:
Author: LeMightyWorrier

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 9,980Chapters: 9/?Kudos: 123

Summary: Folk magic: Usually simple charms, spells or rituals passed down from person to person or within a community, commonly used for healing, luck, fertility, divination and protection from harm.Folk belief: A broad genre of folklore that is often expressed in narratives, customs, rituals, foodways, proverbs, and rhymes.Merlin's use of charms and cures leads Arthur to believe that Merlin is a sorcerer. Little does Arthur know, Merlin is, in fact, a sorcerer. Either way, he's going to keep the idiot from the pyre.

entry.summary:
Author: Lancelotsurvivedinmyheart

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,931Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 66

Summary: “What the hell are you doing in my flat, you absolute tit?” Merlin exclaimed, irritation clearly showing in his voice. He took a defensive stance, keys clutched tight. Shit. The man opened his stunningly blue eyes (double shit) and slowly rolled his head to meet Merlin’s perplexed glare. He was unfairly calm for this insane scenario. “I, to answer your... elloquent question, was invited to your… if you can even call it a flat? By a harpy of a woman.” he said slowly, as if talking to a child. entry.title: Cruel Summer (Merlin's Version)
entry.summary:
Author: mittwoch

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 21,969Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 36

Summary: Merlin stood there and stared back with his mouth hung open, probably looking utterly flabbergasted, because the prince was not supposed to be there. They specifically told Merlin he would never have contact with the royal family when he accepted the promotion of working at Balmoral Castle, the royal family's holiday home, during the summer. It was a known fact that the Pendragon household spent their summers at Balmoral Castle, so yeah, Merlin expected to see the royal family but never to actually talk to them. ♡♡♡ Despite being utterly annoyed by Prince Arthur, Merlin develops an unexpected relationship with the prince and finds himself sneaking down to the gates of the Garden Cottage each night to meet up with him.

entry.title: A Dawn of Dragons
entry.summary:
Author: graciousImsuchaNerd

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,973Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 122

Summary: Fate is finally drawing Emrys to the Once and Future King.King Arthur begins his reign with hope for peace. He strikes his father's magic ban and invites magic users to the castle for help drafting laws fair to all of Camelot's citizens. One of those invitations is sent to Balinor, the man he believes to be the last dragonlord. But unbeknowest to him, Balinor wasn't the last, and Merlin is one of the last things Arthur was expecting.
